question: A 20-day-old baby is brought to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) with complaints of vomiting for 2 days. On examination, the baby is severely dehydrated, heart rate is 165 beats/min, respiratory rate is 68 breaths/min, and the temperature is 98 F. Arterial blood gases (ABGs) reveal severe metabolic acidosis, Na = 120 mEq/L, K = 5.8 mEq/L, urea = 62 mg/dL, Cr = 1.0 mg/dL, and random blood sugar (RBS) = 30 mg/dL. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A couple brings their 13-year-old son to the outpatient department because he has not developed secondary sexual characters yet. On examination, testicular volume is 1.6 ml and penis size is 2.5 cm. According to the above examination, this child belongs to which of the following Tanner’s stages?

A couple brings their 12-year-old daughter to the clinic because she has not developed secondary sexual characters yet. On examination, there is no glandular tissue, areola follows the skin contours, and no pubic hair is seen. According to the above examination, this child belongs to which of the following Tanner’s stages?

A couple brings their 6-year-old daughter to the outpatient department. Her bilateral breast bud formation started two months ago. On examination, breast buds are observed with a small area of surrounding glandular tissue. Areolas have begun to widen. According to the above examination, this child belongs to which of the following Tanner’s stages?

A couple brings their 6-year-old son to the outpatient department (OPD) after his pubic hair started growing 2 months ago. On examination, testicular volume is around 10 ml, penile length is about 6 cm, and pubic hair is coarse and curly. According to the above examination, this child belongs to which of the following Tanner’s stages?
What is the definition of short stature?

answers.option: Height below three standard deviations from the mean
Height below one standard deviation from the mean

question: Which of these terms describes Kallmann syndrome?
Congenital hypothyroidism is most commonly associated with which of the following?
What is the most common cause of growth hormone deficiency?
A 9-year-old kid presents with features suggestive of dwarfism. What is the most common cause of this condition?
On physical examination, which of these features is suggestive of achondroplasia?
A 9-month-old kid presents with a history of prolonged jaundice and umbilical hernia. What is the most likely etiology?
Which one of these features regarding achondroplasia is true?

answers.option: Increased upper body segment to lower body segment ratio
Decreased upper body segment to lower body segment ratio

question: Which of the following is used for the screening of congenital hypothyroidism?

An infant presents to the outpatient department with complaints of lethargy, difficulty in feeding, and constipation for the past 1 month. On examination, the baby has a protruded tongue, husky cry, and an umbilical hernia. Laboratory results show an increased level of TSH and reduced levels of free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 11-year-old girl has a short stature and increased weight. She also complains of cold intolerance and increased sleep. Her bone age is delayed. Lab results show an increased level of TSH and a reduced free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most appropriate test for neonatal screening of hypothyroidism?

answers.option: Total T4 and AMP: T3 levels

question: A 6-month-old infant is brought to the outpatient department with by his parents with concerns about his general health. According to them, he was born at term at home with good weight and length but had a history of prolonged jaundice. Now they feel he is not active; he sleeps more and feeds less. There is also a history of constipation. On examination, the anterior fontanelle is open and large and the posterior fontanelle is still open. Which is the most likely investigation that will help in the diagnosis?

A 13-year-old girl presented with her parents with complaints of rapid decreased in her weight. According to the parents she has also complain of tremulousness, headache, mood disturbances, behavioral swings, difficulties with sleep, decrease in attention span, hyperactivity and a decline in school performance. On examination her eyes are protruded with lid lag. Her skin is smooth and flushed with excessive sweating. She is tachycardic with increased systolic blood pressure and a widened pulse pressure. What should be the treatment of choice to treat her underlying condition?

An 8-year-old male is brought to the clinic by his parents concerned about his short stature compared to his peers. The parents mention a family history of late bloomers, with both parents having experienced a growth spurt in their later teen years. The patient's growth velocity is within normal limits, and he has no other concerning medical history. On physical examination, he has appropriate secondary sexual characteristics for his age. What is the most likely diagnosis of patient's short stature?
A child suffers from growth hormone deficiency. Which of the following is the best indicator?
